title: Theological Ideas in the Gospel of Mary

questions.question: According to the Gospel of Mary, what is the ultimate fate of matter?
choices: It will be eternally preserved
It will be transformed into spirit
It will be resolved into its own roots
It will be judged and condemned
questions.answer: It will be resolved into its own roots

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary view the concept of sin?
choices: As an inherent part of human nature
As a violation of divine law
As a result of misunderstanding one's true nature
As an unforgivable act against God
questions.answer: As a result of misunderstanding one's true nature

questions.question: What is the primary means of salvation according to the Gospel of Mary?
choices: Faith in Christ's death and resurrection
Adherence to moral laws
Acquisition of spiritual knowledge (gnosis)
Participation in sacraments
questions.answer: Acquisition of spiritual knowledge (gnosis)

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's view of the body differ from mainstream Christian teaching?
choices: It sees the body as eternal
It views the body as a temple of the Holy Spirit
It considers the body as temporary and ultimately dissolved
It believes in the physical resurrection of the body
questions.answer: It considers the body as temporary and ultimately dissolved

questions.question: What philosophical influences are evident in the Gospel of Mary?
choices: Aristotelian logic
Epicureanism
Platonic and Stoic philosophy
Cynicism
questions.answer: Platonic and Stoic philosophy

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary portray Mary Magdalene?
choices: As a repentant sinner
As a spiritual leader and teacher
As a minor disciple
As Jesus' wife
questions.answer: As a spiritual leader and teacher

questions.question: What is the Gospel of Mary's stance on establishing new religious rules?
choices: It encourages creating detailed laws
It warns against setting up rules beyond those given by the Savior
It advocates for a strict hierarchical structure
It is neutral on the subject
questions.answer: It warns against setting up rules beyond those given by the Savior

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary describe the soul's journey after death?
choices: Immediate judgment by God
Reincarnation into another body
Ascent through levels of spiritual powers or archons
Eternal sleep until the final resurrection
questions.answer: Ascent through levels of spiritual powers or archons

questions.question: What is the primary focus of salvation in the Gospel of Mary?
choices: Forgiveness of sins
Eternal life in heaven
Inner transformation and self-discovery
Escape from hell
questions.answer: Inner transformation and self-discovery

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary view the relationship between the material and spiritual realms?
choices: As equally important and interconnected
As a sharp distinction with the spiritual realm superior
As illusions created by human perception
As different aspects of the same reality
questions.answer: As a sharp distinction with the spiritual realm superior

questions.question: What does the Gospel of Mary suggest about spiritual authority?
choices: It should be based on apostolic succession
It should be determined by democratic vote
It should be based on one's level of spiritual understanding
It should be inherited through family lineage
questions.answer: It should be based on one's level of spiritual understanding

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's concept of sin differ from traditional Christian views?
choices: It denies the existence of sin
It sees sin as a debt to be paid
It views sin as a genetic inheritance
It considers sin as a personal offense against God
questions.answer: It denies the existence of sin

questions.question: What role does Jesus play in the salvation process according to the Gospel of Mary?
choices: Sacrificial lamb
Judge of the living and the dead
Revealer of truth
Mediator between God and humans
questions.answer: Revealer of truth

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary challenge traditional gender roles in early Christianity?
choices: By advocating for women's ordination
By portraying Mary Magdalene as a recipient of special revelation
By arguing for gender equality in all aspects of life
By promoting matriarchal church structures
questions.answer: By portraying Mary Magdalene as a recipient of special revelation

questions.question: What is the Gospel of Mary's view on the nature of evil?
choices: Evil is a powerful force opposing God
Evil is an illusion created by ignorance
Evil is the absence of good
Evil is a necessary part of creation
questions.answer: Evil is an illusion created by ignorance

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary describe the origin of suffering?
choices: As a punishment for sin
As a result of karma
As a consequence of the soul's entanglement with matter
As a test from God
questions.answer: As a consequence of the soul's entanglement with matter

questions.question: What is the significance of gnosis in the Gospel of Mary?
choices: It is a secret ritual for initiates
It is the key to salvation and spiritual freedom
It is a form of intellectual study
It is a type of mystical experience
questions.answer: It is the key to salvation and spiritual freedom

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary view the role of faith in salvation?
choices: As the sole requirement for salvation
As less important than knowledge
As equal to works in importance
As unnecessary for spiritual growth
questions.answer: As less important than knowledge

questions.question: What does the Gospel of Mary suggest about the nature of the divine?
choices: God is a personal being
The divine is an impersonal force
There are multiple gods
The true nature of the divine is unknowable
questions.answer: The divine is an impersonal force

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's cosmology differ from mainstream Christian beliefs?
choices: It posits multiple heavens and hells
It describes a journey through spiritual powers or archons
It denies the existence of an afterlife
It teaches reincarnation
questions.answer: It describes a journey through spiritual powers or archons

questions.question: What is the Gospel of Mary's stance on religious rituals?
choices: They are essential for salvation
They are helpful but not necessary
They are potential distractions from true spirituality
They should be performed daily
questions.answer: They are potential distractions from true spirituality

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary view the concept of divine judgment?
choices: As a future event where God judges all souls
As an ongoing process of self-realization
As a myth used to control people
As unnecessary since there is no sin
questions.answer: As unnecessary since there is no sin

questions.question: What is the Gospel of Mary's perspective on the physical world?
choices: It is inherently evil
It is an illusion to be transcended
It is good but temporary
It is the only reality that exists
questions.answer: It is an illusion to be transcended

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary portray the relationship between Jesus and his disciples?
choices: As a traditional teacher-student relationship
As equals in spiritual understanding
As a hierarchical structure with Jesus at the top
As a family unit
questions.answer: As equals in spiritual understanding

questions.question: What is the Gospel of Mary's view on the purpose of human existence?
choices: To worship and serve God
To attain spiritual knowledge and return to the divine realm
To procreate and populate the earth
To achieve material success and happiness
questions.answer: To attain spiritual knowledge and return to the divine realm

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary address the concept of resurrection?
choices: It affirms bodily resurrection
It denies any form of resurrection
It teaches spiritual resurrection through knowledge
It is silent on the matter
questions.answer: It teaches spiritual resurrection through knowledge

questions.question: What is the Gospel of Mary's stance on asceticism?
choices: It strongly encourages ascetic practices
It views asceticism as unnecessary
It condemns all forms of self-denial
It leaves the choice to individual practitioners
questions.answer: It views asceticism as unnecessary

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary view the role of scripture?
choices: As the infallible word of God
As helpful but secondary to direct spiritual insight
As completely irrelevant
As the only source of truth
questions.answer: As helpful but secondary to direct spiritual insight

questions.question: What does the Gospel of Mary suggest about the nature of truth?
choices: Truth is objective and unchanging
Truth is subjective and personal
Truth is revealed through inner spiritual knowledge
Truth is unknowable to humans
questions.answer: Truth is revealed through inner spiritual knowledge

questions.question: How does the Gospel of Mary's soteriology (doctrine of salvation) differ from orthodox Christianity?
choices: It emphasizes works over faith
It focuses on knowledge rather than belief
It requires both faith and works equally
It denies the possibility of salvation
questions.answer: It focuses on knowledge rather than belief
